description:
Verifies whether 3D Secure is available for the specified BIN or card brand. For 3D Secure 2, this endpoint also returns device fingerprinting keys.

For more information, refer to [3D Secure 2](https://docs.adyen.com/online-payments/3d-secure/native-3ds2).
api_description:
The BIN Lookup API provides endpoints for retrieving information, such as cost estimates, and 3D Secure supported version based on a given BIN.

## Authentication
You need an [API credential](https://docs.adyen.com/development-resources/api-credentials) to authenticate to the API.

If using an API key, add an `X-API-Key` header with the API key as the value, for example:

 ```
curl
-H "Content-Type: application/json" \
-H "X-API-Key: YOUR_API_KEY" \
...
```

Alternatively, you can use the username and password to connect to the API using basic authentication, for example:

```
curl
-U "ws@Company.YOUR_COMPANY_ACCOUNT":"YOUR_BASIC_AUTHENTICATION_PASSWORD" \
-H "Content-Type: application/json" \
...
```

## Versioning
The BinLookup API supports [versioning](https://docs.adyen.com/development-resources/versioning) using a version suffix in the endpoint URL. This suffix has the following format: "vXX", where XX is the version number.

For example:
```
https://pal-test.adyen.com/pal/servlet/BinLookup/v52/get3dsAvailability
```## Going live

To authneticate to the live endpoints, you need an [API credential](https://docs.adyen.com/development-resources/api-credentials) from your live Customer Area.

The live endpoint URLs contain a prefix which is unique to your company account:
```

https://{PREFIX}-pal-live.adyenpayments.com/pal/servlet/BinLookup/v52/get3dsAvailability
```

Get your `{PREFIX}` from your live Customer Area under **Developers** > **API URLs** > **Prefix**.

instruction_candidates.candidate: To ensure a secure and compliant transaction process, I want to check if 3D Secure is available for the given card brand or BIN number using the Adyen BinLookup API. With this API, I can confidently provide a frictionless yet secure payment experience to my customers. Please guide me on how to make this API call effectively.

###Input:
I need to know how to get a fees cost estimate with the Adyen BinLookup API.
###Output:
Functionality: Get a fees cost estimate
Description: >This API is available only for merchants operating in Australia, the EU, and the UK.

Use the Adyen Cost Estimation API to pre-calculate interchange and scheme fee costs. Knowing these costs prior actual payment authorisation gives you an opportunity to charge those costs to the cardholder, if necessary.

To retrieve this information, make the call to the `/getCostEstimate` endpoint. The response to this call contains the amount of the interchange and scheme fees charged by the network for this transaction, and also which surcharging policy is possible (based on current regulations).

> Since not all information is known in advance (for example, if the cardholder will successfully authenticate via 3D Secure or if you also plan to provide additional Level 2/3 data), the returned amounts are based on a set of assumption criteria you define in the `assumptions` parameter.
Endpoint: post-getCostEstimate
API: Adyen BinLookup API

Use the Adyen Cost Estimation API to pre-calculate interchange and scheme fee costs. Knowing these costs prior actual payment authorisation gives you an opportunity to charge those costs to the cardholder, if necessary.

To retrieve this information, make the call to the `/getCostEstimate` endpoint. The response to this call contains the amount of the interchange and scheme fees charged by the network for this transaction, and also which surcharging policy is possible (based on current regulations).

> Since not all information is known in advance (for example, if the cardholder will successfully authenticate via 3D Secure or if you also plan to provide additional Level 2/3 data), the returned amounts are based on a set of assumption criteria you define in the `assumptions` parameter.
Endpoint: post-getCostEstimate
API: Adyen BinLookup API

api_description:
The BIN Lookup API provides endpoints for retrieving information, such as cost estimates, and 3D Secure supported version based on a given BIN.

## Authentication
You need an [API credential](https://docs.adyen.com/development-resources/api-credentials) to authenticate to the API.

If using an API key, add an `X-API-Key` header with the API key as the value, for example:

 ```
curl
-H "Content-Type: application/json" \
-H "X-API-Key: YOUR_API_KEY" \
...
```

Alternatively, you can use the username and password to connect to the API using basic authentication, for example:

```
curl
-U "ws@Company.YOUR_COMPANY_ACCOUNT":"YOUR_BASIC_AUTHENTICATION_PASSWORD" \
-H "Content-Type: application/json" \
...
```

## Versioning
The BinLookup API supports [versioning](https://docs.adyen.com/development-resources/versioning) using a version suffix in the endpoint URL. This suffix has the following format: "vXX", where XX is the version number.

For example:
```
https://pal-test.adyen.com/pal/servlet/BinLookup/v52/get3dsAvailability
```## Going live

To authneticate to the live endpoints, you need an [API credential](https://docs.adyen.com/development-resources/api-credentials) from your live Customer Area.

The live endpoint URLs contain a prefix which is unique to your company account:
```

https://{PREFIX}-pal-live.adyenpayments.com/pal/servlet/BinLookup/v52/get3dsAvailability
```

Get your `{PREFIX}` from your live Customer Area under **Developers** > **API URLs** > **Prefix**.

I need to know how to get a fees cost estimate with the Adyen BinLookup API.
###Output:
Functionality: Get a fees cost estimate
Description: >This API is available only for merchants operating in Australia, the EU, and the UK.

Use the Adyen Cost Estimation API to pre-calculate interchange and scheme fee costs. Knowing these costs prior actual payment authorisation gives you an opportunity to charge those costs to the cardholder, if necessary.

To retrieve this information, make the call to the `/getCostEstimate` endpoint. The response to this call contains the amount of the interchange and scheme fees charged by the network for this transaction, and also which surcharging policy is possible (based on current regulations).

> Since not all information is known in advance (for example, if the cardholder will successfully authenticate via 3D Secure or if you also plan to provide additional Level 2/3 data), the returned amounts are based on a set of assumption criteria you define in the `assumptions` parameter.
Endpoint: post-getCostEstimate
API: Adyen BinLookup API

best_instruction.candidate: I want to ensure that 3D Secure is supported for a specific card brand or BIN before initiating a transaction with the Adyen BinLookup API. If the card in question supports 3D Secure 2, I'd also like to receive the associated device fingerprinting keys for improved security. Please help me format the correct request for the post-get3dsAvailability endpoint.

api_call:
import http.client

conn = http.client.HTTPSConnection("pal-test.adyen.com")

payload = "{\"additionalData\":{\"property1\":\"string\",\"property2\":\"string\"},\"brands\":[\"string\"],\"cardNumber\":\"string\",\"merchantAccount\":\"string\",\"recurringDetailReference\":\"string\",\"shopperReference\":\"string\"}"

headers = {
    'Authorization': "Basic REPLACE_BASIC_AUTH",
    'content-type': "application/json"
    }

conn.request("POST", "/pal/servlet/BinLookup/v52/get3dsAvailability", payload, headers)

res = conn.getresponse()
data = res.read()

print(data.decode("utf-8"))
description:
Verifies whether 3D Secure is available for the specified BIN or card brand. For 3D Secure 2, this endpoint also returns device fingerprinting keys.

For more information, refer to [3D Secure 2](https://docs.adyen.com/online-payments/3d-secure/native-3ds2).
api_description:
The BIN Lookup API provides endpoints for retrieving information, such as cost estimates, and 3D Secure supported version based on a given BIN.

## Authentication
You need an [API credential](https://docs.adyen.com/development-resources/api-credentials) to authenticate to the API.

If using an API key, add an `X-API-Key` header with the API key as the value, for example:

 ```
curl
-H "Content-Type: application/json" \
-H "X-API-Key: YOUR_API_KEY" \
...
```

Alternatively, you can use the username and password to connect to the API using basic authentication, for example:

```
curl
-U "ws@Company.YOUR_COMPANY_ACCOUNT":"YOUR_BASIC_AUTHENTICATION_PASSWORD" \
-H "Content-Type: application/json" \
...
```

## Versioning
The BinLookup API supports [versioning](https://docs.adyen.com/development-resources/versioning) using a version suffix in the endpoint URL. This suffix has the following format: "vXX", where XX is the version number.

For example:
```
https://pal-test.adyen.com/pal/servlet/BinLookup/v52/get3dsAvailability
```## Going live

To authneticate to the live endpoints, you need an [API credential](https://docs.adyen.com/development-resources/api-credentials) from your live Customer Area.

The live endpoint URLs contain a prefix which is unique to your company account:
```

https://{PREFIX}-pal-live.adyenpayments.com/pal/servlet/BinLookup/v52/get3dsAvailability
```

Get your `{PREFIX}` from your live Customer Area under **Developers** > **API URLs** > **Prefix**.

For 3D Secure 2, it would also return device fingerprinting keys, which I understand is an added benefit.

api_call:
package main

import (
	"fmt"
	"strings"
	"net/http"
	"io/ioutil"
)

func main() {

	url := "https://pal-test.adyen.com/pal/servlet/BinLookup/v52/get3dsAvailability"

	payload := strings.NewReader("{\"additionalData\":{\"property1\":\"string\",\"property2\":\"string\"},\"brands\":[\"string\"],\"cardNumber\":\"string\",\"merchantAccount\":\"string\",\"recurringDetailReference\":\"string\",\"shopperReference\":\"string\"}")

	req, _ := http.NewRequest("POST", url, payload)

	req.Header.Add("Authorization", "Basic REPLACE_BASIC_AUTH")
	req.Header.Add("content-type", "application/json")

	res, _ := http.DefaultClient.Do(req)

	defer res.Body.Close()
	body, _ := ioutil.ReadAll(res.Body)

	fmt.Println(res)
	fmt.Println(string(body))

}
description:
Verifies whether 3D Secure is available for the specified BIN or card brand. For 3D Secure 2, this endpoint also returns device fingerprinting keys.

For more information, refer to [3D Secure 2](https://docs.adyen.com/online-payments/3d-secure/native-3ds2).
api_description:
The BIN Lookup API provides endpoints for retrieving information, such as cost estimates, and 3D Secure supported version based on a given BIN.

## Authentication
You need an [API credential](https://docs.adyen.com/development-resources/api-credentials) to authenticate to the API.

If using an API key, add an `X-API-Key` header with the API key as the value, for example:

 ```
curl
-H "Content-Type: application/json" \
-H "X-API-Key: YOUR_API_KEY" \
...
```

Alternatively, you can use the username and password to connect to the API using basic authentication, for example:

```
curl
-U "ws@Company.YOUR_COMPANY_ACCOUNT":"YOUR_BASIC_AUTHENTICATION_PASSWORD" \
-H "Content-Type: application/json" \
...
```

## Versioning
The BinLookup API supports [versioning](https://docs.adyen.com/development-resources/versioning) using a version suffix in the endpoint URL. This suffix has the following format: "vXX", where XX is the version number.

For example:
```
https://pal-test.adyen.com/pal/servlet/BinLookup/v52/get3dsAvailability
```## Going live

To authneticate to the live endpoints, you need an [API credential](https://docs.adyen.com/development-resources/api-credentials) from your live Customer Area.

The live endpoint URLs contain a prefix which is unique to your company account:
```

https://{PREFIX}-pal-live.adyenpayments.com/pal/servlet/BinLookup/v52/get3dsAvailability
```

Get your `{PREFIX}` from your live Customer Area under **Developers** > **API URLs** > **Prefix**.

best_instruction.candidate: I want to ensure that 3D Secure is supported for a specific card based on its BIN. Using the Adyen BinLookup API, how do I make a query to determine if 3D Secure is available and receive device fingerprinting keys if it is 3D Secure 2?

api_call:
require 'uri'
require 'net/http'
require 'openssl'

url = URI("https://pal-test.adyen.com/pal/servlet/BinLookup/v52/get3dsAvailability")

http = Net::HTTP.new(url.host, url.port)
http.use_ssl = true
http.verify_mode = OpenSSL::SSL::VERIFY_NONE

request = Net::HTTP::Post.new(url)
request["Authorization"] = 'Basic REPLACE_BASIC_AUTH'
request["content-type"] = 'application/json'
request.body = "{\"additionalData\":{\"property1\":\"string\",\"property2\":\"string\"},\"brands\":[\"string\"],\"cardNumber\":\"string\",\"merchantAccount\":\"string\",\"recurringDetailReference\":\"string\",\"shopperReference\":\"string\"}"

response = http.request(request)
puts response.read_body
description:
Verifies whether 3D Secure is available for the specified BIN or card brand. For 3D Secure 2, this endpoint also returns device fingerprinting keys.

For more information, refer to [3D Secure 2](https://docs.adyen.com/online-payments/3d-secure/native-3ds2).
api_description:
The BIN Lookup API provides endpoints for retrieving information, such as cost estimates, and 3D Secure supported version based on a given BIN.

## Authentication
You need an [API credential](https://docs.adyen.com/development-resources/api-credentials) to authenticate to the API.

If using an API key, add an `X-API-Key` header with the API key as the value, for example:

 ```
curl
-H "Content-Type: application/json" \
-H "X-API-Key: YOUR_API_KEY" \
...
```

Alternatively, you can use the username and password to connect to the API using basic authentication, for example:

```
curl
-U "ws@Company.YOUR_COMPANY_ACCOUNT":"YOUR_BASIC_AUTHENTICATION_PASSWORD" \
-H "Content-Type: application/json" \
...
```

## Versioning
The BinLookup API supports [versioning](https://docs.adyen.com/development-resources/versioning) using a version suffix in the endpoint URL. This suffix has the following format: "vXX", where XX is the version number.

For example:
```
https://pal-test.adyen.com/pal/servlet/BinLookup/v52/get3dsAvailability
```## Going live

To authneticate to the live endpoints, you need an [API credential](https://docs.adyen.com/development-resources/api-credentials) from your live Customer Area.

The live endpoint URLs contain a prefix which is unique to your company account:
```

https://{PREFIX}-pal-live.adyenpayments.com/pal/servlet/BinLookup/v52/get3dsAvailability
```

Get your `{PREFIX}` from your live Customer Area under **Developers** > **API URLs** > **Prefix**.

###Input:
I need to know how to get a fees cost estimate with the Adyen BinLookup API.
###Output:
Functionality: Get a fees cost estimate
Description: >This API is available only for merchants operating in Australia, the EU, and the UK.

Use the Adyen Cost Estimation API to pre-calculate interchange and scheme fee costs. Knowing these costs prior actual payment authorisation gives you an opportunity to charge those costs to the cardholder, if necessary.

To retrieve this information, make the call to the `/getCostEstimate` endpoint. The response to this call contains the amount of the interchange and scheme fees charged by the network for this transaction, and also which surcharging policy is possible (based on current regulations).

> Since not all information is known in advance (for example, if the cardholder will successfully authenticate via 3D Secure or if you also plan to provide additional Level 2/3 data), the returned amounts are based on a set of assumption criteria you define in the `assumptions` parameter.
Endpoint: post-getCostEstimate
API: Adyen BinLookup API

best_instruction.candidate: How can I determine if 3D Secure is supported for a given credit card BIN or brand using Adyen BinLookup API? If the card is enrolled in 3D Secure 2, could I also retrieve device fingerprinting keys?

api_call:
<?php

$curl = curl_init();

curl_setopt_array($curl, [
  CURLOPT_URL => "https://pal-test.adyen.com/pal/servlet/BinLookup/v52/get3dsAvailability",
  CURLOPT_RETURNTRANSFER => true,
  CURLOPT_ENCODING => "",
  CURLOPT_MAXREDIRS => 10,
  CURLOPT_TIMEOUT => 30,
  CURLOPT_HTTP_VERSION => CURL_HTTP_VERSION_1_1,
  CURLOPT_CUSTOMREQUEST => "POST",
  CURLOPT_POSTFIELDS => "{\"additionalData\":{\"property1\":\"string\",\"property2\":\"string\"},\"brands\":[\"string\"],\"cardNumber\":\"string\",\"merchantAccount\":\"string\",\"recurringDetailReference\":\"string\",\"shopperReference\":\"string\"}",
  CURLOPT_HTTPHEADER => [
    "Authorization: Basic REPLACE_BASIC_AUTH",
    "content-type: application/json"
  ],
]);

$response = curl_exec($curl);
$err = curl_error($curl);

curl_close($curl);

if ($err) {
  echo "cURL Error #:" . $err;
} else {
  echo $response;
}
description:
Verifies whether 3D Secure is available for the specified BIN or card brand. For 3D Secure 2, this endpoint also returns device fingerprinting keys.

For more information, refer to [3D Secure 2](https://docs.adyen.com/online-payments/3d-secure/native-3ds2).
api_description:
The BIN Lookup API provides endpoints for retrieving information, such as cost estimates, and 3D Secure supported version based on a given BIN.

## Authentication
You need an [API credential](https://docs.adyen.com/development-resources/api-credentials) to authenticate to the API.

If using an API key, add an `X-API-Key` header with the API key as the value, for example:

 ```
curl
-H "Content-Type: application/json" \
-H "X-API-Key: YOUR_API_KEY" \
...
```

Alternatively, you can use the username and password to connect to the API using basic authentication, for example:

```
curl
-U "ws@Company.YOUR_COMPANY_ACCOUNT":"YOUR_BASIC_AUTHENTICATION_PASSWORD" \
-H "Content-Type: application/json" \
...
```

## Versioning
The BinLookup API supports [versioning](https://docs.adyen.com/development-resources/versioning) using a version suffix in the endpoint URL. This suffix has the following format: "vXX", where XX is the version number.

For example:
```
https://pal-test.adyen.com/pal/servlet/BinLookup/v52/get3dsAvailability
```## Going live

To authneticate to the live endpoints, you need an [API credential](https://docs.adyen.com/development-resources/api-credentials) from your live Customer Area.

The live endpoint URLs contain a prefix which is unique to your company account:
```

https://{PREFIX}-pal-live.adyenpayments.com/pal/servlet/BinLookup/v52/get3dsAvailability
```

Get your `{PREFIX}` from your live Customer Area under **Developers** > **API URLs** > **Prefix**.

Your task is to create a user query that effectively utilizes a specific API. The API's functionality, description, and name will be provided to you. Your query should be designed in a way that makes the best use of this API's unique capabilities. When crafting your query, focus on:

1. **API Name Integration:** Clearly include the API's name in your query to ensure relevance.
2. **Specificity:** Replace broad or vague terms with precise, concrete details relevant to the API's purpose.
3. **Conciseness:** Keep your query as brief as possible while still fully conveying the needed information. Avoid unnecessary verbosity.
4. **Excluding API Endpoint:** Do not include the API's endpoint in your query; focus only on the user's need and how the API fulfills it.

Create a query that a user might realistically use when interacting with the given API. Think about typical scenarios or problems that the API is designed to solve and formulate your query accordingly.

Examples for practice:
###Input:
Functionality: Check if 3D Secure is available
Description: Verifies whether 3D Secure is available for the specified BIN or card brand. For 3D Secure 2, this endpoint also returns device fingerprinting keys.

For more information, refer to [3D Secure 2](https://docs.adyen.com/online-payments/3d-secure/native-3ds2).
Endpoint: post-get3dsAvailability
API: Adyen BinLookup API
###Output:
I need to verifies whether 3d secure is available for the specified bin or card brand. for 3d secure 2, this endpoint also returns device fingerprinting keys.

for more information, refer to [3d secure 2](https://docs.adyen.com/online-payments/3d-secure/native-3ds2). with the Adyen BinLookup API. Please help me with that.

###Input:
Functionality: Get a fees cost estimate
Description: >This API is available only for merchants operating in Australia, the EU, and the UK.

Use the Adyen Cost Estimation API to pre-calculate interchange and scheme fee costs. Knowing these costs prior actual payment authorisation gives you an opportunity to charge those costs to the cardholder, if necessary.

To retrieve this information, make the call to the `/getCostEstimate` endpoint. The response to this call contains the amount of the interchange and scheme fees charged by the network for this transaction, and also which surcharging policy is possible (based on current regulations).

> Since not all information is known in advance (for example, if the cardholder will successfully authenticate via 3D Secure or if you also plan to provide additional Level 2/3 data), the returned amounts are based on a set of assumption criteria you define in the `assumptions` parameter.
Endpoint: post-getCostEstimate
API: Adyen BinLookup API

I need to know how to get a fees cost estimate with the Adyen BinLookup API.

best_instruction.candidate:
I want to ensure that 3D Secure is supported for the given card brand or BIN number before processing a payment. With the Adyen BinLookup API, I can quickly check for 3D Secure availability and, if applicable, retrieve device fingerprinting keys for 3D Secure 2 transactions.

Could you please provide an example of how to construct a proper request to the `post-get3dsAvailability` endpoint using this API? I'd like to confirm 3D Secure compatibility for card transactions in my system.

description:
Verifies whether 3D Secure is available for the specified BIN or card brand. For 3D Secure 2, this endpoint also returns device fingerprinting keys.

For more information, refer to [3D Secure 2](https://docs.adyen.com/online-payments/3d-secure/native-3ds2).
api_description:
The BIN Lookup API provides endpoints for retrieving information, such as cost estimates, and 3D Secure supported version based on a given BIN.

## Authentication
You need an [API credential](https://docs.adyen.com/development-resources/api-credentials) to authenticate to the API.

If using an API key, add an `X-API-Key` header with the API key as the value, for example:

 ```
curl
-H "Content-Type: application/json" \
-H "X-API-Key: YOUR_API_KEY" \
...
```

Alternatively, you can use the username and password to connect to the API using basic authentication, for example:

```
curl
-U "ws@Company.YOUR_COMPANY_ACCOUNT":"YOUR_BASIC_AUTHENTICATION_PASSWORD" \
-H "Content-Type: application/json" \
...
```

## Versioning
The BinLookup API supports [versioning](https://docs.adyen.com/development-resources/versioning) using a version suffix in the endpoint URL. This suffix has the following format: "vXX", where XX is the version number.

For example:
```
https://pal-test.adyen.com/pal/servlet/BinLookup/v52/get3dsAvailability
```## Going live

To authneticate to the live endpoints, you need an [API credential](https://docs.adyen.com/development-resources/api-credentials) from your live Customer Area.

The live endpoint URLs contain a prefix which is unique to your company account:
```

https://{PREFIX}-pal-live.adyenpayments.com/pal/servlet/BinLookup/v52/get3dsAvailability
```

Get your `{PREFIX}` from your live Customer Area under **Developers** > **API URLs** > **Prefix**.

best_instruction.candidate: To determine if 3D Secure is an option for a specific payment card, I will make use of Adyen BinLookup API's `post-get3dsAvailability` endpoint. The API will provide information about 3D Secure availability and additional device fingerprinting keys for 3D Secure 2. description:
>This API is available only for merchants operating in Australia, the EU, and the UK.

Use the Adyen Cost Estimation API to pre-calculate interchange and scheme fee costs. Knowing these costs prior actual payment authorisation gives you an opportunity to charge those costs to the cardholder, if necessary.

To retrieve this information, make the call to the `/getCostEstimate` endpoint. The response to this call contains the amount of the interchange and scheme fees charged by the network for this transaction, and also which surcharging policy is possible (based on current regulations).

> Since not all information is known in advance (for example, if the cardholder will successfully authenticate via 3D Secure or if you also plan to provide additional Level 2/3 data), the returned amounts are based on a set of assumption criteria you define in the `assumptions` parameter.
api_description:
The BIN Lookup API provides endpoints for retrieving information, such as cost estimates, and 3D Secure supported version based on a given BIN.

## Authentication
You need an [API credential](https://docs.adyen.com/development-resources/api-credentials) to authenticate to the API.

If using an API key, add an `X-API-Key` header with the API key as the value, for example:

 ```
curl
-H "Content-Type: application/json" \
-H "X-API-Key: YOUR_API_KEY" \
...
```

Alternatively, you can use the username and password to connect to the API using basic authentication, for example:

```
curl
-U "ws@Company.YOUR_COMPANY_ACCOUNT":"YOUR_BASIC_AUTHENTICATION_PASSWORD" \
-H "Content-Type: application/json" \
...
```

## Versioning
The BinLookup API supports [versioning](https://docs.adyen.com/development-resources/versioning) using a version suffix in the endpoint URL. This suffix has the following format: "vXX", where XX is the version number.

For example:
```
https://pal-test.adyen.com/pal/servlet/BinLookup/v52/get3dsAvailability
```## Going live

To authneticate to the live endpoints, you need an [API credential](https://docs.adyen.com/development-resources/api-credentials) from your live Customer Area.

The live endpoint URLs contain a prefix which is unique to your company account:
```

https://{PREFIX}-pal-live.adyenpayments.com/pal/servlet/BinLookup/v52/get3dsAvailability
```

Get your `{PREFIX}` from your live Customer Area under **Developers** > **API URLs** > **Prefix**.

To initiate this process, could you provide guidance on how to format and send the correct request to the `/getCostEstimate` endpoint using the Adyen BinLookup API?
###Output:
Functionality: Get a fees cost estimate
Description: >This API is available only for merchants operating in Australia, the EU, and the UK.

Use the Adyen Cost Estimation API to pre-calculate interchange and scheme fee costs. Knowing these costs prior actual payment authorisation gives you an opportunity to charge those costs to the cardholder, if necessary.

To retrieve this information, make the call to the `/getCostEstimate` endpoint. The response to this call contains the amount of the interchange and scheme fees charged by the network for this transaction, and also which surcharging policy is possible (based on current regulations).

> Since not all information is known in advance (for example, if the cardholder will successfully authenticate via 3D Secure or if you also plan to provide additional Level 2/3 data), the returned amounts are based on a set of assumption criteria you define in the `assumptions` parameter.
Endpoint: post-getCostEstimate
API: Adyen BinLookup API

description:
>This API is available only for merchants operating in Australia, the EU, and the UK.

Use the Adyen Cost Estimation API to pre-calculate interchange and scheme fee costs. Knowing these costs prior actual payment authorisation gives you an opportunity to charge those costs to the cardholder, if necessary.

To retrieve this information, make the call to the `/getCostEstimate` endpoint. The response to this call contains the amount of the interchange and scheme fees charged by the network for this transaction, and also which surcharging policy is possible (based on current regulations).

> Since not all information is known in advance (for example, if the cardholder will successfully authenticate via 3D Secure or if you also plan to provide additional Level 2/3 data), the returned amounts are based on a set of assumption criteria you define in the `assumptions` parameter.
api_description:
The BIN Lookup API provides endpoints for retrieving information, such as cost estimates, and 3D Secure supported version based on a given BIN.

## Authentication
You need an [API credential](https://docs.adyen.com/development-resources/api-credentials) to authenticate to the API.

If using an API key, add an `X-API-Key` header with the API key as the value, for example:

 ```
curl
-H "Content-Type: application/json" \
-H "X-API-Key: YOUR_API_KEY" \
...
```

Alternatively, you can use the username and password to connect to the API using basic authentication, for example:

```
curl
-U "ws@Company.YOUR_COMPANY_ACCOUNT":"YOUR_BASIC_AUTHENTICATION_PASSWORD" \
-H "Content-Type: application/json" \
...
```

## Versioning
The BinLookup API supports [versioning](https://docs.adyen.com/development-resources/versioning) using a version suffix in the endpoint URL. This suffix has the following format: "vXX", where XX is the version number.

For example:
```
https://pal-test.adyen.com/pal/servlet/BinLookup/v52/get3dsAvailability
```## Going live

To authneticate to the live endpoints, you need an [API credential](https://docs.adyen.com/development-resources/api-credentials) from your live Customer Area.

The live endpoint URLs contain a prefix which is unique to your company account:
```

https://{PREFIX}-pal-live.adyenpayments.com/pal/servlet/BinLookup/v52/get3dsAvailability
```

Get your `{PREFIX}` from your live Customer Area under **Developers** > **API URLs** > **Prefix**.

description:
>This API is available only for merchants operating in Australia, the EU, and the UK.

Use the Adyen Cost Estimation API to pre-calculate interchange and scheme fee costs. Knowing these costs prior actual payment authorisation gives you an opportunity to charge those costs to the cardholder, if necessary.

To retrieve this information, make the call to the `/getCostEstimate` endpoint. The response to this call contains the amount of the interchange and scheme fees charged by the network for this transaction, and also which surcharging policy is possible (based on current regulations).

> Since not all information is known in advance (for example, if the cardholder will successfully authenticate via 3D Secure or if you also plan to provide additional Level 2/3 data), the returned amounts are based on a set of assumption criteria you define in the `assumptions` parameter.
api_description:
The BIN Lookup API provides endpoints for retrieving information, such as cost estimates, and 3D Secure supported version based on a given BIN.

## Authentication
You need an [API credential](https://docs.adyen.com/development-resources/api-credentials) to authenticate to the API.

If using an API key, add an `X-API-Key` header with the API key as the value, for example:

 ```
curl
-H "Content-Type: application/json" \
-H "X-API-Key: YOUR_API_KEY" \
...
```

Alternatively, you can use the username and password to connect to the API using basic authentication, for example:

```
curl
-U "ws@Company.YOUR_COMPANY_ACCOUNT":"YOUR_BASIC_AUTHENTICATION_PASSWORD" \
-H "Content-Type: application/json" \
...
```

## Versioning
The BinLookup API supports [versioning](https://docs.adyen.com/development-resources/versioning) using a version suffix in the endpoint URL. This suffix has the following format: "vXX", where XX is the version number.

For example:
```
https://pal-test.adyen.com/pal/servlet/BinLookup/v52/get3dsAvailability
```## Going live

To authneticate to the live endpoints, you need an [API credential](https://docs.adyen.com/development-resources/api-credentials) from your live Customer Area.

The live endpoint URLs contain a prefix which is unique to your company account:
```

https://{PREFIX}-pal-live.adyenpayments.com/pal/servlet/BinLookup/v52/get3dsAvailability
```

Get your `{PREFIX}` from your live Customer Area under **Developers** > **API URLs** > **Prefix**.

best_instruction.candidate: I'd like to get a fees cost estimate prior to payment authorization using the Adyen Cost Estimation API. Please help me construct a request with assumptions to retrieve interchange and scheme fees, as well as possible surcharging policies.

api_call:
import http.client

conn = http.client.HTTPSConnection("pal-test.adyen.com")

payload = "{\"amount\":{\"currency\":\"str\",\"value\":0},\"assumptions\":{\"assume3DSecureAuthenticated\":true,\"assumeLevel3Data\":true,\"installments\":0},\"cardNumber\":\"string\",\"encryptedCardNumber\":\"string\",\"merchantAccount\":\"string\",\"merchantDetails\":{\"countryCode\":\"st\",\"enrolledIn3DSecure\":true,\"mcc\":\"string\"},\"recurring\":{\"contract\":\"ONECLICK\",\"recurringDetailName\":\"string\",\"recurringExpiry\":\"2019-08-24T14:15:22Z\",\"recurringFrequency\":\"string\",\"tokenService\":\"VISATOKENSERVICE\"},\"selectedRecurringDetailReference\":\"string\",\"shopperInteraction\":\"Ecommerce\",\"shopperReference\":\"string\"}"

headers = {
    'Authorization': "Basic REPLACE_BASIC_AUTH",
    'content-type': "application/json"
    }

conn.request("POST", "/pal/servlet/BinLookup/v52/getCostEstimate", payload, headers)

res = conn.getresponse()
data = res.read()

print(data.decode("utf-8"))
description:
>This API is available only for merchants operating in Australia, the EU, and the UK.

Use the Adyen Cost Estimation API to pre-calculate interchange and scheme fee costs. Knowing these costs prior actual payment authorisation gives you an opportunity to charge those costs to the cardholder, if necessary.

To retrieve this information, make the call to the `/getCostEstimate` endpoint. The response to this call contains the amount of the interchange and scheme fees charged by the network for this transaction, and also which surcharging policy is possible (based on current regulations).

> Since not all information is known in advance (for example, if the cardholder will successfully authenticate via 3D Secure or if you also plan to provide additional Level 2/3 data), the returned amounts are based on a set of assumption criteria you define in the `assumptions` parameter.
api_description:
The BIN Lookup API provides endpoints for retrieving information, such as cost estimates, and 3D Secure supported version based on a given BIN.

## Authentication
You need an [API credential](https://docs.adyen.com/development-resources/api-credentials) to authenticate to the API.

If using an API key, add an `X-API-Key` header with the API key as the value, for example:

 ```
curl
-H "Content-Type: application/json" \
-H "X-API-Key: YOUR_API_KEY" \
...
```

Alternatively, you can use the username and password to connect to the API using basic authentication, for example:

```
curl
-U "ws@Company.YOUR_COMPANY_ACCOUNT":"YOUR_BASIC_AUTHENTICATION_PASSWORD" \
-H "Content-Type: application/json" \
...
```

## Versioning
The BinLookup API supports [versioning](https://docs.adyen.com/development-resources/versioning) using a version suffix in the endpoint URL. This suffix has the following format: "vXX", where XX is the version number.

For example:
```
https://pal-test.adyen.com/pal/servlet/BinLookup/v52/get3dsAvailability
```## Going live

To authneticate to the live endpoints, you need an [API credential](https://docs.adyen.com/development-resources/api-credentials) from your live Customer Area.

The live endpoint URLs contain a prefix which is unique to your company account:
```

https://{PREFIX}-pal-live.adyenpayments.com/pal/servlet/BinLookup/v52/get3dsAvailability
```

Get your `{PREFIX}` from your live Customer Area under **Developers** > **API URLs** > **Prefix**.

To get the fees estimate, I will send a request to the /getCostEstimate endpoint of the Adyen BinLookup API. The response I expect to receive will include the interchange and scheme fees charged by the network, along with the surcharging policy that is permitted based on current regulations.

Because some details, like the 3D Secure authentication result or Level 2/3 data, might not be available at the time of this request, I will need to provide some assumption criteria in the `assumptions` parameter to calculate a reasonable estimate.

For more details on using the Adyen BinLookup API and the /getCostEstimate endpoint, please refer to their documentation.

Functionality: Get a fees cost estimate
Description: >This API is available only for merchants operating in Australia, the EU, and the UK.

Use the Adyen Cost Estimation API to pre-calculate interchange and scheme fee costs. Knowing these costs prior actual payment authorisation gives you an opportunity to charge those costs to the cardholder, if necessary.

To retrieve this information, make the call to the `/getCostEstimate` endpoint. The response to this call contains the amount of the interchange and scheme fees charged by the network for this transaction, and also which surcharging policy is possible (based on current regulations).

> Since not all information is known in advance (for example, if the cardholder will successfully authenticate via 3D Secure or if you also plan to provide additional Level 2/3 data), the returned amounts are based on a set of assumption criteria you define in the `assumptions` parameter.
Endpoint: post-getCostEstimate
API: Adyen BinLookup API

api_call:
package main

import (
	"fmt"
	"strings"
	"net/http"
	"io/ioutil"
)

func main() {

	url := "https://pal-test.adyen.com/pal/servlet/BinLookup/v52/getCostEstimate"

	payload := strings.NewReader("{\"amount\":{\"currency\":\"str\",\"value\":0},\"assumptions\":{\"assume3DSecureAuthenticated\":true,\"assumeLevel3Data\":true,\"installments\":0},\"cardNumber\":\"string\",\"encryptedCardNumber\":\"string\",\"merchantAccount\":\"string\",\"merchantDetails\":{\"countryCode\":\"st\",\"enrolledIn3DSecure\":true,\"mcc\":\"string\"},\"recurring\":{\"contract\":\"ONECLICK\",\"recurringDetailName\":\"string\",\"recurringExpiry\":\"2019-08-24T14:15:22Z\",\"recurringFrequency\":\"string\",\"tokenService\":\"VISATOKENSERVICE\"},\"selectedRecurringDetailReference\":\"string\",\"shopperInteraction\":\"Ecommerce\",\"shopperReference\":\"string\"}")

	req, _ := http.NewRequest("POST", url, payload)

	req.Header.Add("Authorization", "Basic REPLACE_BASIC_AUTH")
	req.Header.Add("content-type", "application/json")

	res, _ := http.DefaultClient.Do(req)

	defer res.Body.Close()
	body, _ := ioutil.ReadAll(res.Body)

	fmt.Println(res)
	fmt.Println(string(body))

}
description:
>This API is available only for merchants operating in Australia, the EU, and the UK.

Use the Adyen Cost Estimation API to pre-calculate interchange and scheme fee costs. Knowing these costs prior actual payment authorisation gives you an opportunity to charge those costs to the cardholder, if necessary.

To retrieve this information, make the call to the `/getCostEstimate` endpoint. The response to this call contains the amount of the interchange and scheme fees charged by the network for this transaction, and also which surcharging policy is possible (based on current regulations).

> Since not all information is known in advance (for example, if the cardholder will successfully authenticate via 3D Secure or if you also plan to provide additional Level 2/3 data), the returned amounts are based on a set of assumption criteria you define in the `assumptions` parameter.
api_description:
The BIN Lookup API provides endpoints for retrieving information, such as cost estimates, and 3D Secure supported version based on a given BIN.

## Authentication
You need an [API credential](https://docs.adyen.com/development-resources/api-credentials) to authenticate to the API.

If using an API key, add an `X-API-Key` header with the API key as the value, for example:

 ```
curl
-H "Content-Type: application/json" \
-H "X-API-Key: YOUR_API_KEY" \
...
```

Alternatively, you can use the username and password to connect to the API using basic authentication, for example:

```
curl
-U "ws@Company.YOUR_COMPANY_ACCOUNT":"YOUR_BASIC_AUTHENTICATION_PASSWORD" \
-H "Content-Type: application/json" \
...
```

## Versioning
The BinLookup API supports [versioning](https://docs.adyen.com/development-resources/versioning) using a version suffix in the endpoint URL. This suffix has the following format: "vXX", where XX is the version number.

For example:
```
https://pal-test.adyen.com/pal/servlet/BinLookup/v52/get3dsAvailability
```## Going live

To authneticate to the live endpoints, you need an [API credential](https://docs.adyen.com/development-resources/api-credentials) from your live Customer Area.

The live endpoint URLs contain a prefix which is unique to your company account:
```

https://{PREFIX}-pal-live.adyenpayments.com/pal/servlet/BinLookup/v52/get3dsAvailability
```

Get your `{PREFIX}` from your live Customer Area under **Developers** > **API URLs** > **Prefix**.

api_call:
require 'uri'
require 'net/http'
require 'openssl'

url = URI("https://pal-test.adyen.com/pal/servlet/BinLookup/v52/getCostEstimate")

http = Net::HTTP.new(url.host, url.port)
http.use_ssl = true
http.verify_mode = OpenSSL::SSL::VERIFY_NONE

request = Net::HTTP::Post.new(url)
request["Authorization"] = 'Basic REPLACE_BASIC_AUTH'
request["content-type"] = 'application/json'
request.body = "{\"amount\":{\"currency\":\"str\",\"value\":0},\"assumptions\":{\"assume3DSecureAuthenticated\":true,\"assumeLevel3Data\":true,\"installments\":0},\"cardNumber\":\"string\",\"encryptedCardNumber\":\"string\",\"merchantAccount\":\"string\",\"merchantDetails\":{\"countryCode\":\"st\",\"enrolledIn3DSecure\":true,\"mcc\":\"string\"},\"recurring\":{\"contract\":\"ONECLICK\",\"recurringDetailName\":\"string\",\"recurringExpiry\":\"2019-08-24T14:15:22Z\",\"recurringFrequency\":\"string\",\"tokenService\":\"VISATOKENSERVICE\"},\"selectedRecurringDetailReference\":\"string\",\"shopperInteraction\":\"Ecommerce\",\"shopperReference\":\"string\"}"

response = http.request(request)
puts response.read_body
description:
>This API is available only for merchants operating in Australia, the EU, and the UK.

Use the Adyen Cost Estimation API to pre-calculate interchange and scheme fee costs. Knowing these costs prior actual payment authorisation gives you an opportunity to charge those costs to the cardholder, if necessary.

To retrieve this information, make the call to the `/getCostEstimate` endpoint. The response to this call contains the amount of the interchange and scheme fees charged by the network for this transaction, and also which surcharging policy is possible (based on current regulations).

> Since not all information is known in advance (for example, if the cardholder will successfully authenticate via 3D Secure or if you also plan to provide additional Level 2/3 data), the returned amounts are based on a set of assumption criteria you define in the `assumptions` parameter.
api_description:
The BIN Lookup API provides endpoints for retrieving information, such as cost estimates, and 3D Secure supported version based on a given BIN.

## Authentication
You need an [API credential](https://docs.adyen.com/development-resources/api-credentials) to authenticate to the API.

If using an API key, add an `X-API-Key` header with the API key as the value, for example:

 ```
curl
-H "Content-Type: application/json" \
-H "X-API-Key: YOUR_API_KEY" \
...
```

Alternatively, you can use the username and password to connect to the API using basic authentication, for example:

```
curl
-U "ws@Company.YOUR_COMPANY_ACCOUNT":"YOUR_BASIC_AUTHENTICATION_PASSWORD" \
-H "Content-Type: application/json" \
...
```

## Versioning
The BinLookup API supports [versioning](https://docs.adyen.com/development-resources/versioning) using a version suffix in the endpoint URL. This suffix has the following format: "vXX", where XX is the version number.

For example:
```
https://pal-test.adyen.com/pal/servlet/BinLookup/v52/get3dsAvailability
```## Going live

To authneticate to the live endpoints, you need an [API credential](https://docs.adyen.com/development-resources/api-credentials) from your live Customer Area.

The live endpoint URLs contain a prefix which is unique to your company account:
```

https://{PREFIX}-pal-live.adyenpayments.com/pal/servlet/BinLookup/v52/get3dsAvailability
```

Get your `{PREFIX}` from your live Customer Area under **Developers** > **API URLs** > **Prefix**.

I want to calculate the interchange and scheme fees for an upcoming transaction using the Adyen Cost Estimation API. This feature is essential for merchants working in Australia, the EU, and the UK. By estimating these fees before the actual payment authorization, I can consider passing the costs to the cardholder, if needed.

api_call:
<?php

$curl = curl_init();

curl_setopt_array($curl, [
  CURLOPT_URL => "https://pal-test.adyen.com/pal/servlet/BinLookup/v52/getCostEstimate",
  CURLOPT_RETURNTRANSFER => true,
  CURLOPT_ENCODING => "",
  CURLOPT_MAXREDIRS => 10,
  CURLOPT_TIMEOUT => 30,
  CURLOPT_HTTP_VERSION => CURL_HTTP_VERSION_1_1,
  CURLOPT_CUSTOMREQUEST => "POST",
  CURLOPT_POSTFIELDS => "{\"amount\":{\"currency\":\"str\",\"value\":0},\"assumptions\":{\"assume3DSecureAuthenticated\":true,\"assumeLevel3Data\":true,\"installments\":0},\"cardNumber\":\"string\",\"encryptedCardNumber\":\"string\",\"merchantAccount\":\"string\",\"merchantDetails\":{\"countryCode\":\"st\",\"enrolledIn3DSecure\":true,\"mcc\":\"string\"},\"recurring\":{\"contract\":\"ONECLICK\",\"recurringDetailName\":\"string\",\"recurringExpiry\":\"2019-08-24T14:15:22Z\",\"recurringFrequency\":\"string\",\"tokenService\":\"VISATOKENSERVICE\"},\"selectedRecurringDetailReference\":\"string\",\"shopperInteraction\":\"Ecommerce\",\"shopperReference\":\"string\"}",
  CURLOPT_HTTPHEADER => [
    "Authorization: Basic REPLACE_BASIC_AUTH",
    "content-type: application/json"
  ],
]);

$response = curl_exec($curl);
$err = curl_error($curl);

curl_close($curl);

if ($err) {
  echo "cURL Error #:" . $err;
} else {
  echo $response;
}
description:
>This API is available only for merchants operating in Australia, the EU, and the UK.

Use the Adyen Cost Estimation API to pre-calculate interchange and scheme fee costs. Knowing these costs prior actual payment authorisation gives you an opportunity to charge those costs to the cardholder, if necessary.

To retrieve this information, make the call to the `/getCostEstimate` endpoint. The response to this call contains the amount of the interchange and scheme fees charged by the network for this transaction, and also which surcharging policy is possible (based on current regulations).

> Since not all information is known in advance (for example, if the cardholder will successfully authenticate via 3D Secure or if you also plan to provide additional Level 2/3 data), the returned amounts are based on a set of assumption criteria you define in the `assumptions` parameter.
api_description:
The BIN Lookup API provides endpoints for retrieving information, such as cost estimates, and 3D Secure supported version based on a given BIN.

## Authentication
You need an [API credential](https://docs.adyen.com/development-resources/api-credentials) to authenticate to the API.

If using an API key, add an `X-API-Key` header with the API key as the value, for example:

 ```
curl
-H "Content-Type: application/json" \
-H "X-API-Key: YOUR_API_KEY" \
...
```

Alternatively, you can use the username and password to connect to the API using basic authentication, for example:

```
curl
-U "ws@Company.YOUR_COMPANY_ACCOUNT":"YOUR_BASIC_AUTHENTICATION_PASSWORD" \
-H "Content-Type: application/json" \
...
```

## Versioning
The BinLookup API supports [versioning](https://docs.adyen.com/development-resources/versioning) using a version suffix in the endpoint URL. This suffix has the following format: "vXX", where XX is the version number.

For example:
```
https://pal-test.adyen.com/pal/servlet/BinLookup/v52/get3dsAvailability
```## Going live

To authneticate to the live endpoints, you need an [API credential](https://docs.adyen.com/development-resources/api-credentials) from your live Customer Area.

The live endpoint URLs contain a prefix which is unique to your company account:
```

https://{PREFIX}-pal-live.adyenpayments.com/pal/servlet/BinLookup/v52/get3dsAvailability
```

Get your `{PREFIX}` from your live Customer Area under **Developers** > **API URLs** > **Prefix**.

To initiate the request, please guide me on how to format the call to the `/getCostEstimate` endpoint, providing any essential assumption criteria.
instruction_candidates.input_text:
Functionality: Get a fees cost estimate
Description: >This API is available only for merchants operating in Australia, the EU, and the UK.

Use the Adyen Cost Estimation API to pre-calculate interchange and scheme fee costs. Knowing these costs prior actual payment authorisation gives you an opportunity to charge those costs to the cardholder, if necessary.

To retrieve this information, make the call to the `/getCostEstimate` endpoint. The response to this call contains the amount of the interchange and scheme fees charged by the network for this transaction, and also which surcharging policy is possible (based on current regulations).

> Since not all information is known in advance (for example, if the cardholder will successfully authenticate via 3D Secure or if you also plan to provide additional Level 2/3 data), the returned amounts are based on a set of assumption criteria you define in the `assumptions` parameter.
Endpoint: post-getCostEstimate
API: Adyen BinLookup API

best_instruction.candidate: I'd like to request a fees cost estimate using the Adyen Cost Estimation API. With this information, I can determine the interchange and scheme fees for an upcoming transaction, allowing me to consider the option of passing these costs onto the cardholder if necessary. To initiate the request, please guide me on how to format the call to the `/getCostEstimate` endpoint, providing any essential assumption criteria.

api_call:
import Foundation

let headers = [
  "Authorization": "Basic REPLACE_BASIC_AUTH",
  "content-type": "application/json"
]
let parameters = [
  "amount": [
    "currency": "str",
    "value": 0
  ],
  "assumptions": [
    "assume3DSecureAuthenticated": true,
    "assumeLevel3Data": true,
    "installments": 0
  ],
  "cardNumber": "string",
  "encryptedCardNumber": "string",
  "merchantAccount": "string",
  "merchantDetails": [
    "countryCode": "st",
    "enrolledIn3DSecure": true,
    "mcc": "string"
  ],
  "recurring": [
    "contract": "ONECLICK",
    "recurringDetailName": "string",
    "recurringExpiry": "2019-08-24T14:15:22Z",
    "recurringFrequency": "string",
    "tokenService": "VISATOKENSERVICE"
  ],
  "selectedRecurringDetailReference": "string",
  "shopperInteraction": "Ecommerce",
  "shopperReference": "string"
] as [String : Any]

let postData = JSONSerialization.data(withJSONObject: parameters, options: [])

let request = NSMutableURLRequest(url: NSURL(string: "https://pal-test.adyen.com/pal/servlet/BinLookup/v52/getCostEstimate")! as URL,
                                        cachePolicy: .useProtocolCachePolicy,
                                    timeoutInterval: 10.0)
request.httpMethod = "POST"
request.allHTTPHeaderFields = headers
request.httpBody = postData as Data

let session = URLSession.shared
let dataTask = session.dataTask(with: request as URLRequest, completionHandler: { (data, response, error) -> Void in
  if (error != nil) {
    print(error)
  } else {
    let httpResponse = response as? HTTPURLResponse
    print(httpResponse)
  }
})

dataTask.resume()
description:
>This API is available only for merchants operating in Australia, the EU, and the UK.

Use the Adyen Cost Estimation API to pre-calculate interchange and scheme fee costs. Knowing these costs prior actual payment authorisation gives you an opportunity to charge those costs to the cardholder, if necessary.

To retrieve this information, make the call to the `/getCostEstimate` endpoint. The response to this call contains the amount of the interchange and scheme fees charged by the network for this transaction, and also which surcharging policy is possible (based on current regulations).

> Since not all information is known in advance (for example, if the cardholder will successfully authenticate via 3D Secure or if you also plan to provide additional Level 2/3 data), the returned amounts are based on a set of assumption criteria you define in the `assumptions` parameter.
api_description:
The BIN Lookup API provides endpoints for retrieving information, such as cost estimates, and 3D Secure supported version based on a given BIN.

## Authentication
You need an [API credential](https://docs.adyen.com/development-resources/api-credentials) to authenticate to the API.

If using an API key, add an `X-API-Key` header with the API key as the value, for example:

 ```
curl
-H "Content-Type: application/json" \
-H "X-API-Key: YOUR_API_KEY" \
...
```

Alternatively, you can use the username and password to connect to the API using basic authentication, for example:

```
curl
-U "ws@Company.YOUR_COMPANY_ACCOUNT":"YOUR_BASIC_AUTHENTICATION_PASSWORD" \
-H "Content-Type: application/json" \
...
```

## Versioning
The BinLookup API supports [versioning](https://docs.adyen.com/development-resources/versioning) using a version suffix in the endpoint URL. This suffix has the following format: "vXX", where XX is the version number.

For example:
```
https://pal-test.adyen.com/pal/servlet/BinLookup/v52/get3dsAvailability
```## Going live

To authneticate to the live endpoints, you need an [API credential](https://docs.adyen.com/development-resources/api-credentials) from your live Customer Area.

The live endpoint URLs contain a prefix which is unique to your company account:
```

https://{PREFIX}-pal-live.adyenpayments.com/pal/servlet/BinLookup/v52/get3dsAvailability
```

Get your `{PREFIX}` from your live Customer Area under **Developers** > **API URLs** > **Prefix**.

By making a call to the `/getCostEstimate` endpoint, I can pre-calculate interchange and scheme fees for a transaction occurring in Australia, the EU, or the UK. For more information and guidelines on using this API, please refer to the Adyen Cost Estimation API documentation.
